intro: Fissistigma sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran fissistigma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
